description: Is that decaf? Are you sure? If you've ever felt paranoid about whether you're really getting decaf, and making sure that you're not unwittingly setting yourself up for a sleepless night, Caffeindicator could be for you. Caffeindicator is a litmus-like indicator to test whether coffee is regular or decaf. But this isn't a stand-alone product, at least not the way it was pitched. The idea is to get these indicators printed on the sugar or artificial sweetener packets that you see at the coffee shop, restaurant, or diner. It would have been a good idea for distribution, since it takes advantage of how these packets are already ubiquitous. Unfortunately for the caffeine-averse though, this product still hasn't hit the market, even years after its Shark Tank debut. What was demonstrated on the show was a mock prototype, and the entrepreneur hadn't even yet begun to approach the sweetener packet manufacturers or estimating the cost of such an add-on feature.
title: Caffeindicator

The Squatty Potty allows the user to adapt their home toilet into one that can be used in a squatting position, which helps to reduce straining and even prevent hemorroids and bowel herniation. Squatty Potty is also great for kids, as it gives them a leg up and a place to rest their feet when moving up to the grown-ups toilet. description: If you're like most people, you can hardly function without your smartphone. It goes everywhere you go and you use it repeatedly throughout the day. But unlike most other things that get daily wear and tear, you probably don't wash your phone, so it's been accumulating germs since the day you acquired it. Now thanks to PhoneSoap, there's an easy and highly effective way to zap the microbes off your phone. PhoneSoap is a charger for your smartphone that encloses it in a UV case, which emits light in the UV-C range that kills 99.99% of bacteria. It disinfects your phone it just 5 minutes, but it's also safe to leave it in there all night while it charges too. You'll still be able to hear any notifications through the built-in audio amplifier. One of the advantages of the PhoneSoap charger over other products, such as anti-bacterial wipes for wireless devices, is that it's a one-time investment. You'll be able to use the charger again and again without having to reorder or spend more money. You also won't even need to remember to wipe your phone, since you'll be charging it either way. Although this germicidal phone charger is the company's flagship product, as well as its first, they've also added cleaning pads and a touchscreen polish stick to the lineup.
title: Phone Soap

description: Spikeball started out as a casual outdoors game, but has grown to become a national sensation. Played in a 2 vs. 2 format, teams compete to spike a ball into a bouncy net until one team can't return it, which awards their opposing team a point. This nascent sport is often described as a cross between beach volleyball and foursquare. Spikeball's popularity has been growing, and currently there are over a quarter million players in the United States, as well as over a thousand nationally ranked teams.

description: Shark Wheel is out to literally reinvent the wheel. Their innovative wheel design is not circular, it's Q-shaped, to put it as simply as possible. The team has put Shark Wheel on skateboards, strollers, wagons, and they see countless other possibilities for it. description: Adriana Montano wants to open the first Cat Cafe in Florida. description: Sway Motorsports makes a three-wheeled, all-electric, street legal ride. It's not like other motorcycles or scooters on the market because its control mechanism. Riders don't have to struggle to balance the vehicle or put their foot down at stops, and for the same reason, it's also easier to carry a passenger or baggage on Sway vehicles.
title: Sway Motorsports
